intro: Centaurea semibanatica, commonly known as the Balkan knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink to purple in color. Centaurea semibanatica is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
